results.title: Buried country
results.creator_credit: Andy Nehl, Liz Watts, SBS Independent and Film Australia
results.brief_description: This documentary traces the history of Aboriginal country music over six decades, revealing how Aboriginal Australians have long been inspired by country music and have used it to tell their stories - of everyday life, the connection to the land, the fight for land rights and the struggle for equality. It combines rare archival images and recordings, interviews with musicians, including Jimmy Little, Harry and Wilga Williams, Bob Randall, Roger Knox, Bobby McLeod, Vic Simms, Auriel Andrew, Lionel Rose, Herbie Laughton, Galarrwuy Yunupingu and Troy Cassar-Daley, who speak about the challenges of performing, the discrimination they have faced and the support they have received. The film is both a celebration of the rich tradition of Aboriginal country music and a moving record of indigenous Australia. Based on the book of the same name by Clinton Walker. For further information about the film and related material visit http://buriedcountry.com

results.title: Buried cities
results.brief_description: Shows the excavations and reconstructions of the cities of Pompeii and Herculaneum. Gives an account of the eruption of Vesuvius in 79 AD and depicts life at the time.

results.title: Buried alive, the story of East Timor
results.creator_credit: Rod Hibberd, Fabio Cavadini and Gil Scrine
results.brief_description: In this film we see why the East Timor question is too important to go away. “The Story of East Timor” begins in a neglected corner of the Portuguese colonial empire. In Lisbon, the unexpected fall of the dictatorship projects the people of East Timor into world politics. It is to be a terrible experience. “Buried Alive” exposes some of the ugly truths about the nature of Western democracy, the world media and Third World Colonialism. Rated: PG

results.title: Burger Burger
results.creator_credit: Gavin Jun Jie Tan and Huang Shicong
results.brief_description: The story of a marooned explorer who meets some local wildlife, with a scary - but eventually serendipitous - outcome. This colourful, fast-paced short animation won Best Animation at the Singapore Short Film Awards 2011.

results.title: Burden of dreams
results.brief_description: A documentary by Les Blank which provides a detailed look at the making of the ill-starred five year production of Werner Herzog’s feature film ‘Fitzcarraldo’. Set in the jungle of Peru ‘Fitzcarraldo’ is the story of an opera mad genius (played by Klaus Kinski) who will stop at nothing to achieve his ideal of building an opera house in the middle of the jungle. In many ways the narrative of Fitzcarraldo parallels Herzog’s production experiences. Despite one setback after another in filming: from monsoonal floods to warring native tribespeople, Herzog persisted with his dream until the film was complete. Not a conventional ‘behind-the-scenes’ promotional documentary, but a film which raises the question about the pursuit of art and what it can entail.

results.title: Buongiorno Italia! Programs 11-20
results.brief_description: A double video set containing ten 25 minute episodes numbered 11 to 20 of the Italian language instructional program, “Buongiorno Italia!”. Contents: 11. Revision. 12. Asking for service. 13. Talking about how things are done. 14. Talking about what you’ve been doing. 15. Saying where you’ve been. 16. Revision. 17. Home, family and work. 18. Talking about how things used to be. 19. Tuscany and its people. 20. And so to finish. To be used in conjunction with “Buongiorno Italia!: programs 1-10” and “Buongiorno Italia! [kit]”.

results.title: Buongiorno Italia! Programs 1-10
results.brief_description: A double video set containing ten 25 minute episodes, programs 1 to 10, of the Italian language instruction program, “Buongiorno Italia!”. Contents: 1. How to greet people and ask for something. 2. How to ask where something is. 3. Buying things and asking the price. 4. How to say you like something. 5. Revision. 6. Going places. 7. Getting there and looking around 8. Finding a room. 9. Eating out. 10. Revision. See also “Buongiorno Italia!: programs 11-20” and “Buongiorno Italia! [kit]”.

results.title: Buongiorno Italia! [text]
results.creator_credit: Alan Wilding, Maddalena Fagandini and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Accompanying student text for the audio and video programs in Italian for beginners, “Buongiorno Italia!”. Contains the text of the videos, exercises, reading passages, a key to the exercises, grammar and a glossary.

results.title: Buongiorno Italia! [kit]
results.creator_credit: Alan Wilding, Maddalena Fagandini and BBC
results.brief_description: A kit for the Italian for beginners’ course, “Buongiorno Italia!”, containing three 60 minute audio cassettes for pronunciation practice, a copy of “Teachers’ Notes” and a copy of the student text for the course. See also the double video sets, “Buongiorno Italia!” programs 1-10 and 11-20.

results.title: Bunyip
results.brief_description: Short Flash animation based around a bunyip, an Aboriginal mythical animal, that goes on a journey into town and encounters a drunken man called Larry. Intrigued by Larry, the bunyip sets out on a quest to eat him but has to face several ordeals before finally reaching the drunken Larry.
